items.title: How New York City’s Trees and Shrubs Help Clear Its Air
items.abstract: As advocates are pushing the city to plant more trees, new research shows the role of urban greenery in absorbing carbon emissions.

items.title: The U.S. Will Need Thousands of Wind Farms. Will Small Towns Go Along?
items.abstract: In the fight against climate change, national goals are facing local resistance. One county scheduled 19 nights of meetings to debate one wind farm.

items.title: Facts & Figures: Cutting Carbon Could Save Cities Almost $17 Trillion
items.abstract: Strategies like improving public transit and investing in efficient heating could result in big savings, according to a new report.

items.title: Copenhagen Wants to Show How Cities Can Fight Climate Change
items.abstract: The Danish capital wants to be carbon neutral six years from now. Its plan involves wind, recycling and a very innovative ski hill.

items.title: Let’s Fill Our Cities With Taller, Wooden Buildings
items.abstract: Trees are some of our best allies in solving the climate crisis.
